About Me

About Me

Hello! I'm Jackson Rini and will be graduating with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from the University of Colorado, Boulder in May 2024. Throughout my academic journey, I've delved deep into the captivating realm of computer science, including diverse topics ranging from algorithms and data structures to software engineering and artificial intelligence.

My time at CU Boulder has been marked by enriching experiences, including engaging in various internships and projects. These opportunities have allowed me to collaborate within teams, acquire new skills on the go, and adeptly navigate unforeseen challenges.

Beyond the realm of code, I'm deeply passionate about playing guitar, skiing, exercising in the gym, and reading literature, which provide balance and inspiration in my life. Whether it's learning songs on the guitar or observing different art forms, I find that diverse interests fuel creativity and enrich my perspective as a computer scientist.

As I embark on the next leg of my journey, I'm excited to find projects and challenges in which to immerse myself. I am committed to lifelong learning and continuous growth in the dynamic field of computer science. I'm eager to apply my skills and knowledge to make contributions to meaningful projects. Let's connect and explore how we can collaborate!

Superpowers

Car Price Prediction

Used Cars Market Analysis in Saudi Arabia

Abstract: This project utilizes regression analysis to assess the depreciation rates of used car brands in Saudi Arabia, focusing on mileage as a determining factor. Two datasets were consolidated and cleaned to enhance data quality. Three regression models - Random Forest, Linear Regression, and XGBoost - were employed to predict car prices and evaluate depreciation rates. XGBoost emerged as the most accurate model, revealing insights into which car brands maintain their value best.

Introduction: The COVID-19 pandemic and economic factors have led to a surge in the used car market in Saudi Arabia, prompting a shift in consumer preferences towards more affordable options. Understanding the factors influencing used car depreciation rates has become crucial. This project aims to provide insights into which cars retain their value the most, aiding consumers in making informed purchasing decisions.

Related Work: Previous studies, such as Mammadov (2021) and Erdem & Senturk (2009), have analyzed used car markets using regression techniques, offering valuable insights into factors affecting car prices and depreciation rates.

Main Technique: Data understanding involved consolidating and cleaning datasets, followed by preprocessing for regression analysis. Three regression models - Random Forest, Linear Regression, and XGBoost - were employed to predict car prices and evaluate depreciation rates.

Evaluation: Depreciation rates of different car brands were evaluated using regression models, revealing insights into which brands retain their value best. GMC, Chevrolet, and Mitsubishi were identified as top performers in maintaining value.

Conclusion: This study provides valuable insights into the used car market in Saudi Arabia, particularly regarding depreciation rates of various brands. Consumers can now make more informed decisions when purchasing used cars, maximizing the value of their investment.

Future Work: Future studies aim to enhance data quality by including more diverse datasets and exploring additional predictive analyses, such as deep neural networks. Furthermore, incorporating broader economic factors into the analysis could offer a more comprehensive understanding of the Saudi car market.

Skills

Internships

Vanderbilt University Medical Center

Nasheville, Tennessee

During my internship at Vanderbilt University Medical Center from May 2023 to August 2023, I had the opportunity to contribute significantly to their Clinical Trials Management System (Oncore) by automating the creation of invoiceable items. Leveraging my skills in Python, Selenium, and OCRs, I developed a robust system that streamlined the process, resulting in substantial cost savings and generating incremental annual revenue exceeding $500,000.

My primary focus was to create automated workflows that eliminated manual data entry tasks and reduced the margin for error. By employing Selenium, I crafted scripts to navigate through the Oncore interface seamlessly, interacting with various elements to input and retrieve data efficiently. Additionally, I integrated OCR technology to extract pertinent information from scanned documents, further enhancing the automation process.

Throughout the project, I encountered several challenges, such as adapting the automation scripts to handle diverse document formats and optimizing their performance for large datasets. However, through persistence and problem-solving, I was able to overcome these obstacles and deliver a solution that exceeded expectations.

This internship provided me with invaluable hands-on experience in software development, data automation, and project management within the healthcare industry. It sharpened my technical skills in Python programming, Selenium web automation, and OCR implementation, while also honing my ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

One of the most memorable aspects of this experience was witnessing the tangible impact of my work on the organization's operations and financial outcomes. Seeing the project's success translate into significant revenue growth was incredibly rewarding and reinforced my passion for leveraging technology to drive positive change.

Overall, my internship at Vanderbilt University Medical Center was a transformative experience that equipped me with practical skills, industry insights, and a profound sense of accomplishment. I am grateful for the opportunity to have contributed to such a meaningful project and look forward to applying the knowledge and expertise gained in my future endeavors.

Digital Global Systems

Tysons, Virginia

During my internship at Digital Global Systems from May 2022 to August 2022, I undertook various projects aimed at enhancing the functionality and efficiency of radio frequency boards.

One of my primary responsibilities involved developing programs in C to adjust the gain levels of radio frequency boards. Through meticulous coding and rigorous testing, I successfully implemented algorithms that precisely modulated the gain settings, improving the performance and reliability of the boards.

Furthermore, I spearheaded the optimization of a Python program designed to record and graph gain data obtained from the radio frequency boards. By leveraging advanced libraries such as NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib, I streamlined data processing and visualization, enabling our team to extract meaningful insights and make informed decisions regarding board calibration and performance monitoring.

In addition to gain modulation, I played a pivotal role in data acquisition and analysis by creating Python scripts to download FCC frequency data and conduct thorough preprocessing and cleaning. These scripts automated the tedious task of collecting regulatory information, ensuring compliance and accuracy in our operations while saving valuable time for the team.

Furthermore, I had the opportunity to showcase our work at the radio frequency conference in Las Vegas. Our optimized Python program, coupled with visually compelling graphs generated using Matplotlib, garnered significant attention and appreciation from industry experts, reaffirming the impact of our contributions on the RF engineering community.

Throughout the internship, I encountered various challenges, including debugging complex C programs and optimizing Python scripts for efficient data handling. However, through perseverance and collaboration with my colleagues, I was able to overcome these obstacles and deliver high-quality solutions that exceeded expectations.

This internship provided me with invaluable hands-on experience in software development, data analysis, and RF engineering within the telecommunications industry. It enhanced my proficiency in programming languages such as C and Python, as well as my familiarity with essential data manipulation tools like NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.

One of the most rewarding aspects of this experience was witnessing the tangible impact of my contributions on the company's products and processes. Knowing that my work played a vital role in improving the performance and reliability of radio frequency boards was incredibly fulfilling and reinforced my passion for technology-driven innovation.

Overall, my internship at Digital Global Systems was a transformative journey that equipped me with practical skills, industry knowledge, and a strong foundation for future endeavors in the field of RF engineering and telecommunications. I am grateful for the opportunity to have been part of such a dynamic and forward-thinking team, and I look forward to applying the lessons learned to drive positive change in my career.

fortyAU

Nasheville, Tennessee

During my internship at fortyAU spanning from January 2021 to August 2021, I had the privilege of contributing to a variety of impactful projects, gaining valuable experience in web development and design.

One of the projects I worked on was for Preston Taylor Ministries, where I played a key role in developing pages and forms to enhance their online presence and improve user engagement. By leveraging my skills in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, I helped create intuitive interfaces that effectively communicated the organization's mission and initiatives.

Similarly, I collaborated with MedRenewel, a medical license renewal company, to develop pages and forms that streamlined their online processes and enhanced customer experience. Through meticulous attention to detail and adherence to industry best practices, I contributed to the creation of a professional and functional website that met the needs of both the company and its clients.

In addition to these projects, I was involved in bootstrapping the CrushConnection app, where I contributed to its initial development and launch. This experience provided me with valuable insights into mobile app development and project management, as well as the opportunity to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

Furthermore, I contributed to the construction of pages for HomeworkHotline, a tutoring service in Nashville, leveraging my expertise in web development to create informative and visually appealing content that showcased the organization's services and offerings.

Additionally, I played a role in quality assurance efforts for several websites, including ForeFront Telecare, Potluck, and Cumberland. Through rigorous testing and feedback, I helped ensure the functionality, usability, and overall quality of these websites, contributing to a seamless and satisfying user experience.

Overall, my internship at fortyAU provided me with invaluable hands-on experience, allowing me to expand my skills in web development, design, and project management. I am grateful for the opportunity to have contributed to these impactful initiatives and look forward to applying the knowledge and experiences gained to future endeavors in the field.
